name: Now watch this
description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

key_work.title: CATARACT (concrete)
key_work.credit_line:
Daniel von Sturmer. Aotearoa New Zealand

Aluminium structure, LCD screens, HD video. Indefinite loop

Commissioned by ACMI
key_work.material_description: Multi-channel installation, aluminium structure, LCD screens, HD video
key_work.brief_description: Everyday moments of existence are presented across 60 screens as a complex cacophony of events in CATARACT (concrete). This dynamic and overwhelming assemblage reflects the abundance of moments and messages we encounter in the world, which is represented as a complex and synthesised totality.

constellations_primary.name: Now watch this
constellations_primary.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

links.description: Just as I’m Google smashes together images based on visual rhymes, creating an unending flow of seemingly disparate things, the music video for Rob Cantor’s ‘All I Need Is You’ harnesses the short, repeating power of GIFs to create a beating heart for its song.

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

end.title: Love Is the Message, the Message Is Death
end.brief_description: Love Is the Message, The Message Is Death reflects Jafa’s desire to craft a “black cinema” that is responsive to the “existential, political, and spiritual dimensions” of Black life, comprised of found footage sampled from films, newscasts, sporting events, music videos, and citizen videos.

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

constellations_other.name: Copy, transform and combine
constellations_other.description: You will see me (2020) repurposes material sourced from the history of the moving image – archival footage, news, interviews, documentaries, reality TV, video diaries and social media – to reflect on the way we perform in front of and reveal ourselves to the camera.

links.description: The majority of clips used in ‘All I Need Is You’ were filmed specifically for the song by director Randall Maxwell. Love Is The Message is cut to Kanye West’s ‘Ultralight Beam’, but the compilation of footage came first.

start.title: Love Is the Message, the Message Is Death
start.brief_description: Love Is the Message, The Message Is Death reflects Jafa’s desire to craft a “black cinema” that is responsive to the “existential, political, and spiritual dimensions” of Black life, comprised of found footage sampled from films, newscasts, sporting events, music videos, and citizen videos.

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

constellations_other.name: Copy, transform and combine
constellations_other.description: You will see me (2020) repurposes material sourced from the history of the moving image – archival footage, news, interviews, documentaries, reality TV, video diaries and social media – to reflect on the way we perform in front of and reveal ourselves to the camera.

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

links.description: Love Is The Message smashes together 100 years of representations of black life. Aria Dean’s video essay ‘Eulogy For A Black Mass’ compares contemporary blackness with the life cycles of memes, narrating found online footage.

start.title: CATARACT (concrete)
start.credit_line:
Daniel von Sturmer. Aotearoa New Zealand

Aluminium structure, LCD screens, HD video. Indefinite loop

Commissioned by ACMI
start.material_description: Multi-channel installation, aluminium structure, LCD screens, HD video
start.brief_description: Everyday moments of existence are presented across 60 screens as a complex cacophony of events in CATARACT (concrete). This dynamic and overwhelming assemblage reflects the abundance of moments and messages we encounter in the world, which is represented as a complex and synthesised totality.

constellations_primary.name: Now watch this
constellations_primary.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

links.description: CATARACT (concrete) presents a barrage of small everyday moments, asking you to try and pay attention to everything at once, not unlike I’m Google by Dine Kelberman, which arranges an endless rabbit-hole of mundane photos found on Google Images.

start.title: #AllMyMovies
start.creator_credit: Nastja Säde Rönkkö and Shia LaBeouf

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

end.title: Portraits in Dramatic Time
end.creator_credit: David Michalek, Paul Warner and Moving Portrait
end.brief_description: A series of 40 art films created by artist David Michalek featuring performances of theater artists and actors of all genres and nationalities both well-known and under-recognized.

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

links.description: Shia Labeouf’s extended livestream became a long-form video portrait of sorts, not unlike Alan Rickman’s appearance in Portraits in Dramatic Time, where he makes a cup of tea in extreme slow-motion. Both projects reflect on their subject’s celebrity, and our study of their tiniest actions.

start.title: Portraits in Dramatic Time
start.creator_credit: David Michalek, Paul Warner and Moving Portrait
start.brief_description: A series of 40 art films created by artist David Michalek featuring performances of theater artists and actors of all genres and nationalities both well-known and under-recognized.

end.title: CATARACT (concrete)
end.credit_line:
Daniel von Sturmer. Aotearoa New Zealand

Aluminium structure, LCD screens, HD video. Indefinite loop

Commissioned by ACMI
end.material_description: Multi-channel installation, aluminium structure, LCD screens, HD video
end.brief_description: Everyday moments of existence are presented across 60 screens as a complex cacophony of events in CATARACT (concrete). This dynamic and overwhelming assemblage reflects the abundance of moments and messages we encounter in the world, which is represented as a complex and synthesised totality.

constellations_primary.name: Now watch this
constellations_primary.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

links.description: CATARACT asks the viewer to focus on small moments of life despite a deluge of others. Portraits in Dramatic Time allows you to focus one small moment at a time, by presenting it in extreme slow motion.

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

end.title: "Shia LaBeouf" LIVE
end.brief_description: Choirs, classical musicians, dancers and aerialists perform live on a stage while Rob Cantor narrates a brutal scene about you, the viewer, being stalked through the woods by a blood-soaked Shia LaBeouf - who is also a cannibal.

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

links.description: Rob Cantor is perhaps best known for his song “Shia Labeouf”, which imagines the actor as a cannibal, stalking and killing unwary campers. If that sounds like a mean joke, it’s a joke that Labeouf was in on, making a Citizen Kane-esque appearance at the end.

start.title: "Shia LaBeouf" LIVE
start.brief_description: Choirs, classical musicians, dancers and aerialists perform live on a stage while Rob Cantor narrates a brutal scene about you, the viewer, being stalked through the woods by a blood-soaked Shia LaBeouf - who is also a cannibal.

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

end.title: #AllMyMovies
end.creator_credit: Nastja Säde Rönkkö and Shia LaBeouf

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

links.description: ‘Actual Cannibal Shia Labeouf’ is just one of Labeouf’s contributions to the meme economy. He took the internet by storm in 2017 with a vanity/art project that involved him live-streaming his own face while watching all of his movies in one 72-hour sitting.
